Devotional: FOLLOWING THE DOCTOR’S ORDERS

 

Poem of the Day: The First Men on Mercury by Edwin Morgan

 

Collected Poems of Maya Angelou:

The Couple

 

 

 

 

Entries:

 

         Love for what you do is important.

Entries:

 

LITERARY:  A quote from my reading of the story by Samuel Beckett, ASSUMPTION:  To avoid the expansion of the commonplace is not enough; the highest art reduces significance in order to obtain that inexplicable bombshell perfection. 

TIP:  I’ll be including a tag for every entry in my journal like this will be marked by  tip.

Devotional: ALWAYS THE SAME

 

Poem of the Day: The African Lion by A. E. Housman

 

Collected Poems of Maya Angelou:

The Pusher

Entries:

Entries:

 

         Today marks the day the first world war ended, 1918.

Devotional: THE STRONG ACCEPT RESPONSIBILITY

 

Poem of the Day: Dreamers by Siegfried Sassoon

 

Collected Poems of Maya Angelou:

Chicken-Licken

 

Today's Musical: THREE PIECES FOR TWO VIOLINS AND PIANO 1: PRAELUDIUM BY DMITRI SHOSTAKOVICH (1906–1975)

 

 

 

 

Entries:

 

         I had a fight with Jessica yesterday, I went off saying all the things I didn’t understand, and how sometimes I really lose sense of purpose out of enthusiasm. I later sent a mail saying I’m sorry.

 

         I miss journaling, but the electricity has taken a dive for the sea level, I hope it its steady enough for me to continue with my work.

 

 Caged away a bird, peeled. 

 It had perched on my sill. 

 Beak clack! Clack! 

 Clack! Clack! 

 Strange for a call 

 Now out park. 

 Tap! At the sash 

 Clack! At its glam 

 It pares. Pares it seems 

 Din here, din there; on seam 

 In beams on its shimmery plumage 

 I wrest him in my hands cup siege. 

 And now in a mirror cage 

 A singing page he stages 

 Beak clack! clack! 

 Clack! Clack!

Devotional: MAXIMS FROM THREE WISE MEN

 

Poem of the Day: Abraham Lincoln by Abraham Lincoln

 

Collected Poems of Maya Angelou:

I Almost Remember

 

Today's Musical: GROUND AFTER THE SCOTCH HUMOUR BY NICOLA MATTEIS (FL. 1670–1713)

 

 

 

 

Entries:

 

         It’s been tirade of laziness, having peaked at the suss of Jessica possibly being in love with me. My sister leaving with the tablet also shut my intensions aloof. She will be back tomorrow, outside of that a good nap and a night’s rest is remedy for any ache.

Devotional: BEHOLD, NOW AS EVER

 

Poem of the Day: from The Prophet by Kahlil Gibran

 

Collected Poems of Maya Angelou:

Prisoner

 

Today's Musical: WHITE LIGHT CHORALE BY PARAM VIR (B. 1952)

 

 

 

 

Entries:

 

         I wrote a long ass mail to Jess in order to make things easier to get across to, I have decided to create a folder with all initial good morning mails. I caught myself writing yesterday, and had a moment of awakening.

Devotional: ONCE IS ENOUGH, ONCE IS FOREVER

 

Poem of the Day: In Memoriam by E. A. Mackintosh

 

Collected Poems of Maya Angelou:

Woman Me

 

Today's Musical: ‘WHEN I AM LAID IN EARTH’ FROM DIDO AND AENEAS BY HENRY PURCELL (1659–1695)

 

 

 

 

Entries:

 

         Yesterday was a lazy day, it was so, as I had little energy and couldn’t write Jess, I still am fatigued, even after sleeping so many hours. I did sleep for some yesterday; taking a nap, I hope she isn’t mad at me. I will try to get the chapter ready, probably even get a letter across to her, delighting her in some factoid and fan fiction. Lol.

 

         Waking up today I discover videos by Dua Lipa and Miley Cyrus, also videos by Justin Bieber and Shawn Mendes, the latter called  Monster , an episode from Twilight Zone (Monsters are due on Maple Street) I had seen just the day before (something about how the same technique can be used to control everyone, regardless of where they are) and  Prisoner  the name of the former, also an allusion to a poem by Maya Angelou from the same day (Prisoner). Today’s poem by Maya Angelou goes on to reference frames from the video, how  Children reach between your teeth for charts to live their lives.  Which at the time of seeing it my only bias inference was to see it as Jessica’s  tooth of flair .

Devotional: TRAIN TO LET GO OF WHAT’S NOT YOURS

Entries:

 

         Listening to  Sunburn  by Owl City after listening to Clones, my heart my songs, and Mob ties by Drake, I feel exceptionally great, relaxed. Praise God.
